## Bio

Hi there! I’m Zhiyuan Zhou, an economics and data science enthusiast passionate about turning complex data into actionable insights. I recently graduated from UCLA with degrees in Economics and Statistics & Data Science, where I honed my skills in data analysis, statistical modeling, and quantitative decision-making.

I’m now pursuing a Master of Public Policy (MPP) at the University of Chicago, focusing on how data-driven strategies can shape impactful policies and guide evidence-based decision making.

When I’m not crunching numbers or building models, you’ll find me exploring nature on a hike, capturing moments through my camera lens, or experimenting with new recipes in the kitchen. 

I’m always eager to connect, collaborate, and learn—whether it’s about data, policy, photography, or the best way to cook a perfect stir-fry!
